content.description: <math alttext="The figure shows a 3 column table. The heading for column 1 is “x.” The heading for column 2 is “f of x.” The heading for column 3 is “f prime of x.” There are 3 rows of data in the table. The data are as follows. Row 1. x is 1. f of x is 2. f prime of x is 3. Row 2. x is 2. f of x is 3. f prime of x is 4. Row 3. x is 3. f of x is 5. f prime of x is 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing and differentiable. Selected values of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its derivative <math alttext="f prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> are given in the table above. What is the value of <math alttext="f inverse, prime, of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
